question: 擦る
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>rub</kanji> and this verb means <vocabulary>to rub</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to scrub</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
If you're going <vocabulary>to rub</vocabulary> me like that, I'm going to <reading>sue</reading> (<ja>す</ja>) you. It's making me very uncomfortable. The <reading>cos</reading>t  (<ja>こす</ja>) of your rubbing actions will be high.
    
So this word has two readings and both mean “to rub.” But you usually use <ja>する</ja> for a single action, such as lighting a match or grazing your knee, while <ja>こする</ja> means doing it repeatedly, like when you’re cleaning or polishing something.
